21#ifndef TREE_ASAN
22#define TREE_ASAN
23
24extern void asan_function_start (void);
25extern void asan_finish_file (void);
26extern rtx_insn *asan_emit_stack_protection (rtx, rtx, unsigned int,
27 HOST_WIDE_INT *, tree *, int);
28extern bool asan_protect_global (tree);
29extern void initialize_sanitizer_builtins (void);
30extern tree asan_dynamic_init_call (bool);
31extern bool asan_expand_check_ifn (gimple_stmt_iterator *, bool);
32extern bool asan_expand_mark_ifn (gimple_stmt_iterator *);
33extern bool asan_expand_poison_ifn (gimple_stmt_iterator *, bool *,
34 hash_map<tree, tree> &);
35
36extern gimple_stmt_iterator create_cond_insert_point
37 (gimple_stmt_iterator *, bool, bool, bool, basic_block *, basic_block *);
38
39/* Alias set for accessing the shadow memory. */
40extern alias_set_type asan_shadow_set;
41
42/* Hash set of labels that are either used in a goto, or their address
43 has been taken. */
44extern hash_set <tree> *asan_used_labels;
45
46/* Shadow memory is found at
47 (address >> ASAN_SHADOW_SHIFT) + asan_shadow_offset (). */
48#define ASAN_SHADOW_SHIFT 3
49#define ASAN_SHADOW_GRANULARITY (1UL << ASAN_SHADOW_SHIFT)
50
51/* Red zone size, stack and global variables are padded by ASAN_RED_ZONE_SIZE
52 up to 2 * ASAN_RED_ZONE_SIZE - 1 bytes. */
53#define ASAN_RED_ZONE_SIZE 32
54
55/* Shadow memory values for stack protection. Left is below protected vars,
56 the first pointer in stack corresponding to that offset contains
57 ASAN_STACK_FRAME_MAGIC word, the second pointer to a string describing
58 the frame. Middle is for padding in between variables, right is
59 above the last protected variable and partial immediately after variables
60 up to ASAN_RED_ZONE_SIZE alignment. */
61#define ASAN_STACK_MAGIC_LEFT 0xf1
62#define ASAN_STACK_MAGIC_MIDDLE 0xf2
63#define ASAN_STACK_MAGIC_RIGHT 0xf3
64#define ASAN_STACK_MAGIC_USE_AFTER_RET 0xf5
65#define ASAN_STACK_MAGIC_USE_AFTER_SCOPE 0xf8
66
67#define ASAN_STACK_FRAME_MAGIC 0x41b58ab3
68#define ASAN_STACK_RETIRED_MAGIC 0x45e0360e
69
70#define ASAN_USE_AFTER_SCOPE_ATTRIBUTE "use after scope memory"
71
72/* Various flags for Asan builtins. */
73enum asan_check_flags
74{
75 ASAN_CHECK_STORE = 1 << 0,
76 ASAN_CHECK_SCALAR_ACCESS = 1 << 1,
77 ASAN_CHECK_NON_ZERO_LEN = 1 << 2,
78 ASAN_CHECK_LAST = 1 << 3
79};
80
81/* Flags for Asan check builtins. */
82#define IFN_ASAN_MARK_FLAGS DEF(POISON), DEF(UNPOISON)
83
84enum asan_mark_flags
85{
86#define DEF(X) ASAN_MARK_##X
87 IFN_ASAN_MARK_FLAGS
88#undef DEF
89};
90
91/* Return true if STMT is ASAN_MARK with FLAG as first argument. */
92extern bool asan_mark_p (gimple *stmt, enum asan_mark_flags flag);
93
94/* Return the size of padding needed to insert after a protected
95 decl of SIZE. */
96
97static inline unsigned int
98asan_red_zone_size (unsigned int size)
99{
100 unsigned int c = size & (ASAN_RED_ZONE_SIZE - 1);
101 return c ? 2 * ASAN_RED_ZONE_SIZE - c : ASAN_RED_ZONE_SIZE;
102}
103
104extern bool set_asan_shadow_offset (const char *);
105
106extern void set_sanitized_sections (const char *);
107
108extern bool asan_sanitize_stack_p (void);
109
110/* Return TRUE if builtin with given FCODE will be intercepted by
111 libasan. */
112
113static inline bool
114asan_intercepted_p (enum built_in_function fcode)
115{
116 return fcode == BUILT_IN_INDEX
117 || fcode == BUILT_IN_MEMCHR
118 || fcode == BUILT_IN_MEMCMP
119 || fcode == BUILT_IN_MEMCPY
120 || fcode == BUILT_IN_MEMMOVE
121 || fcode == BUILT_IN_MEMSET
122 || fcode == BUILT_IN_STRCASECMP
123 || fcode == BUILT_IN_STRCAT
124 || fcode == BUILT_IN_STRCHR
125 || fcode == BUILT_IN_STRCMP
126 || fcode == BUILT_IN_STRCPY
127 || fcode == BUILT_IN_STRDUP
128 || fcode == BUILT_IN_STRLEN
129 || fcode == BUILT_IN_STRNCASECMP
130 || fcode == BUILT_IN_STRNCAT
131 || fcode == BUILT_IN_STRNCMP
132 || fcode == BUILT_IN_STRCSPN
133 || fcode == BUILT_IN_STRPBRK
134 || fcode == BUILT_IN_STRSPN
135 || fcode == BUILT_IN_STRSTR
136 || fcode == BUILT_IN_STRNCPY;
137}
138
139/* Return TRUE if we should instrument for use-after-scope sanity checking. */
140
141static inline bool
142asan_sanitize_use_after_scope (void)
143{
144 return (flag_sanitize_address_use_after_scope && asan_sanitize_stack_p ());
145}
146
147static inline bool
148asan_no_sanitize_address_p (void)
149{
150 return lookup_attribute ("no_sanitize_address",
151 DECL_ATTRIBUTES (current_function_decl));
152}
153
154/* Return true if DECL should be guarded on the stack. */
155
156static inline bool
157asan_protect_stack_decl (tree decl)
158{
159 return DECL_P (decl)
160 && (!DECL_ARTIFICIAL (decl)
161 || (asan_sanitize_use_after_scope () && TREE_ADDRESSABLE (decl)));
162}
163
164#endif /* TREE_ASAN */
